executive_summary: The Bagel Stores industry comprises small shops selling bagels, coffee and other breakfast foods. For many people, bagels are a staple breakfast, particularly for workers and people in cities. While demand for bagels typically grows when disposable income levels increase, industry establishments cater to people across income brackets. While people with lower incomes are more likely to make breakfast at home to save money, bagels are often inexpensive enough that the convenience of a fast breakfast can outweigh the cost. Over much of the five years to 2022, disposable income levels increased, keeping demand for bagels mostly consistent. Additionally, per capita coffee consumption has increased, spurring demand for bagel stores, since bagels are a compliment to coffee and a customer buying a coffee may make the spontaneous decision to buy a bagel as well.

current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The distribution of a COVID-19 vaccine and boosters has increased foot traffic for Bagel Stores industry operators. The industry experienced a strong recovery in 2021, with revenue growing 3.8% in 2022 driven by consumer demand as businesses and offices reopened.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Recovering economy and increased foot traffic
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: A recovering economy, helped along by the distribution of vaccines and boosters, was driven by consumer spending. Lowered restrictions have allowed offices and businesses to re-open. Many bagel stores have benefitted from the increased traffic.
Shortages of industry inputs such as flour and yeast have contributed to rising purchase costs and declining profit.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The Bagel Stores industry is expected to experience growth over the five years to 2027, with industry revenue forecast to grow at an annualized rate of 1.0% to $1.5 billion.
Many bagel stores could be threatened by the move away from traditional office settings, as fewer people working in offices will mean less foot-traffic and revenue.
With muted profit over the next five years, consolidation is likely to continue as small companies struggle to establish a strong presence in the industry.

industry_definition: This industry comprises establishments that prepare or serve bagels. Purchases may be consumed on-site, taken out or delivered. A bagel is dough shaped into a ring, and then boiled and baked.

negative_impact_factors: low - increasing barriers to entry level

key_trends: Many bagel stores have benefited from increased foot traffic
Industry profit has been hindered by rising labor costs
High competition and low profit have made it difficult for small companies to thrive in this industry

market_segmentation.segment_description: Generating an estimated 38.6% of industry revenue in 2022, individuals earning less than $70,000 are a major market segment for the industry. Generally, individuals in lower income segments need to make other sacrifices to be able to afford meals away from home.

Generating an estimated 53.8% of industry revenue in 2022, individuals earning more than $70,000 are the largest market for industry products. Consumers in this income bracket tend to have more disposable income to spend on discretionary products such as fresh bakery goods and on-the-go breakfasts rather than eating at home.

Many businesses offer bagels, coffee or other products offered by industry operators as incentives or rewards for employees. In addition, many businesses bring such products to meetings or meet at industry establishments.

products_and_services.product_description: The Bagel Stores industry primarily generates its revenue from bagel sales and related toppings and spreads. Sales of such food items are expected to account for 84.5% of industry revenue.
Food sold by industry establishments are predominantly sold for takeaway, accounting for an estimated 50.9% of industry revenue.

However, some establishments offer food service for in-store dining. Bagel stores that offer bagels for consumption on the premises with or without table service can often charge a premium for added services such as table service to compensate for higher rent expenses due to larger square footage requirements. Consequently, food served for consumption on the premises is expected to account for 33.6% of industry revenue.

Other products are estimated to account for 15.5% of industry revenue in 2022. Other revenue is primarily generated through coffee sales, particularly as industry establishments have expanded hot drink offerings to include higher-end products such as espresso-based beverages. Establishments also often offer an assortment of ready-to-drink beverages and ready-to-eat foods.

demand_determinants.determinant_description: The Bagel Stores industry is highly sensitive to fluctuations in disposable income and consumer spending as higher disposable income levels are necessary to finance discretionary expenditures on food away from home, such as bagels.

Trends in nutrition and health can also affect demand for bagels. As consumers have become increasingly concerned about fats and carbohydrates, demand has been suppressed due to the nature of industry products including bagels and cream cheese.

business_locations.location_description: The West region is one of the most populous regions in the United States, holding an estimated 17.2% of the total population. As a result, an estimated 25.5% of industry establishments are located in this area.

regulations_points.regulation_description: Bagel stores must comply with FDA regulations on food handling, presentation and nutritional labeling.
Subject to minimum wage laws and Affordable Care Act requirements for larger employers to provide healthcare.
Some larger operators with franchises must follow franchising disclosure, registration and relationship laws.
Pandemic led to increased regulations like capacity limits, safety measures and paid leave requirements that have since eased.

No data provided to interpret globalization level.

basis_points.basis_description: Operators compete predominantly on price, location, food quality, ambiance, service, consistency, food range and variety.
Bagel stores face competition from food service sector operators like fast food, full-service restaurants, coffee shops offering similar products. Competition also from consumers eating at home.

concentration_points.concentration_description: The industry is dominated by small, locally owned businesses with only a few national/regional chains. Most stores generate relatively small revenue share.
The pandemic is expected to cause many smaller businesses to close, increasing market concentration over the next 5 years.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Labor represents an important cost, accounting for 37.0% of revenue in 2022 due to increases in minimum wage and employee retention challenges.

Purchase of ingredients like flour, yeast, salt and supplies like packaging account for the second largest cost at 36.1% of revenue in 2022, impacted by commodity price changes and pandemic-related shortages.
Rent is an important cost at 5.2% of revenue in 2022, as bagel stores benefit from being in high-traffic areas which typically have higher rents.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The industry relies on employees to prepare food and interact with customers, but also requires specialized equipment that can carry a high price tag. For every $1.00 spent on labor, an estimated $0.10 is spent on capital in 2022.

volatility_points.volatility_description: The pandemic caused significant volatility in 2020 due to diminished demand from stay-at-home orders and supply chain disruptions.
Normally the industry has low volatility, with stable demand for the inexpensive breakfast option and revenue shifts mainly from product price and income changes.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Low-cost POS systems can increase efficiency by speeding up service and enabling more payment options like mobile wallets.
Partnering with delivery apps and developing branded apps/loyalty programs expands customer base and accessibility.
Social media allows cost-effective targeted marketing and communication with customers.

FAQs.question: What government assistance did the Bagel Stores industry receive during the COVID-19 pandemic?
FAQs.answer: Many industry operators were granted stimulus money from the United States government through the Paycheck Protection Program (PPP) of the CARES Act and extensions in the American Rescue Plan (ARP) Act to assist with payroll, utilities, rent and mortgage obligations during economic impacts of the pandemic.

FAQs.question: What industry associations support the Bagel Stores industry?
FAQs.answer: The National Bagel Association provides news, networking, advertising, research and resources specifically for bagel stores. The National Coffee Association and National Restaurant Association also provide some support.

FAQs.question: Do bagel stores specialize or offer a diversified range of products?
FAQs.answer: Some bagel stores benefit from selling pastries or other breakfast items in addition to bagels.

FAQs.question: Are customers price conscious for bagel products?
FAQs.answer: Many customers expect bagels to be an inexpensive food option.

FAQs.question: Have rising input costs negatively impacted the industry's profitability?
FAQs.answer: Shortages of flour and yeast have impacted industry profitability.

FAQs.question: Do bagel stores lease equipment to reduce overhead costs?
FAQs.answer: Making large quantities of bagels requires specialized equipment, so some stores may lease equipment.

FAQs.question: Have bagel stores been able to reduce wage costs through automation?
FAQs.answer: Some fast casual restaurants have introduced computer screens for customer ordering without cashiers, potentially reducing wage costs.

FAQs.question: What is the level of technological change in bagel store operations?
FAQs.answer: Most bagel shops have a low level of technological change in their operations.

FAQs.question: Do bagel stores face significant regulatory expenses impacting profitability?
FAQs.answer: Like all food service industries, bagel shops are subject to regular health inspections for compliance, which can impact profitability.

FAQs.question: How do bagel stores ensure health and safety requirements are met?
How do bagel store profit margins compare to competitors?
FAQs.answer: Bagel stores typically have tight profit margins.

FAQs.question: How frequently do bagel stores purchase new equipment?
FAQs.answer: Bagel cooking equipment should not need to be replaced frequently, unless a company wants to expand operations.

FAQs.question: Do bagel stores engage in market research to anticipate consumer trends?
FAQs.answer: Companies need to monitor market and consumer needs, wants, and desires, particularly in relation to demand for healthy foods.

FAQs.question: What products or services help differentiate bagel stores from competitors?
FAQs.answer: Stores that offer a wide variety of products are more likely to attract repeat customers and boost revenue.

FAQs.question: Are bagel stores conveniently located for commuters or dominant in certain regional markets?
FAQs.answer: Industry operators that are located in high traffic areas are able to attract more first time customers, which can present a competitive advantage.

FAQs.question: How do changes in consumer spending affect bagel stores?
FAQs.answer: Changes in disposable income and consumer spending levels mainly affect how frequently people visit bagel stores, but due to the inexpensive nature of bagels, changes do not cause significant revenue shifts.

FAQs.question: How does the unemployment rate impact bagel store revenue?
FAQs.answer: Bagel stores often cater to commuters, so when unemployment is high and people are out of work, they are less likely to visit and revenue is impacted.

FAQs.question: How does rising coffee consumption affect bagel stores?
FAQs.answer: Beverage sales, primarily coffee, provide another stream of revenue for bagel stores. As they expand hot drink offerings, they can potentially draw in more consumers.
